column4: hi deleted keyring package by mistake and now unable to boot ubuntu some garbled error message appears after grub
any help
anybody
hi deleted keyring package by mistake and now unable to boot ubuntu some garbled error message appears after grub
hi deleted keyring package by mistake and now unable to boot ubuntu some garbled error message appears after gru
what error message?
cant read the error screen is all garbled/distorted
look at your dpkg.log and install the package(s) again
i tried that it shows blank screen
maybe try f2-f8 and see if any other console has something
nothing on f2-f8
probably
boot the cd, then mount your root filesystem and chroot into it
whats the exact name of the package(s) you removed?
maybe start by booting the cd and looking for the dpkg.log on your root filesystem it will have the package names of the removed packages
i installed it through live cd. So can i mount my old root partition through live environment?
yeah its probably even listed in the filebrowser, if not mount it using the mount command
yeah mount root filesystem, chroot, run apt-get in the chroot env
got the filesystem mounted? or do you need help?
hm, its not that hard usualy, i can try to guide you through that if you want
unless you didnt do much with that ubuntu install yet, then a reinstall would probably be easier
